Sentencas: TheCe-U-O system, forming a solid solution in thefluorite structure, has gained much attention due to its unique properties.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: Mixed fluorite oxide powders of Ce1-x U x O2 & PLUSMN;& delta; compositionswere found to be particularly active for H-2 productionthrough thermochemical water splitting.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: In the present work, we explorethe reduction-oxidation properties of the mixed oxides with x = 0.1, 0.25, and 0.5.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: We report a particularly high oxygenstorage capacity (OSC) for x & GE; 0.25 and showthat the oxygen extracted from these mixed oxides is of a differentorigin than that extracted from CeO2.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: While in ceria, oxygenis extracted from the tetrahedral sites, leading to the formationof oxygen vacancies, the extracted oxygen in Ce1-x U x O2 & PLUSMN;& delta; (x & GE; 0.25) is essentially excess oxygenin the fluorite lattice (which spontaneously penetrates the oxideunder ambient or oxidative conditions).
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: This property, which is clearlyrelated to the change in the valency of the U cations, is apparentlyresponsible for the higher OSC and the lower activation energy foroxygen extraction from the mixed oxides compared to ceria.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: The mixedoxide powders are shown to be structurally stable, retaining theirfluorite structure following reduction under Ar-5%H-2 or oxidation in air until 1000 & DEG;C. The presented results providenew insights into the Ce-U-O system which may be exploitedfor future technical applications, as a catalyst for thermochemicalwater splitting, or as a solid electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: The bulk and surface characteristicsof Ce1-x U x O2 & PLUSMN;& delta; (x & LE; 0.5)oxide powders, under reducingand oxidizing conditions, are studied herein.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications

Sentencas: A particularly highoxygen storage capacity is reported.
Titulo: Exploring the Redox Properties of Ce1-x U x O2±δ (x ≤ 0.5) Oxides for Energy Applications
